citeinfo.title: EnviroAtlas - Cleveland, OH - Estimated Intersection Density of Walkable Roads

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research and Development (ORD) - National Exposure Research Laboratory (NERL)

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

descript.abstract: This EnviroAtlas dataset estimates the intersection density of walkable roads within a 750 meter radius of any given 10 meter pixel in the community. Intersections are defined as any point where 3 or more roads meet and density is calculated using kernel density, where closer intersections are weighted higher than further intersections. Intersection density is highly correlated with walking for transportation. This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose: The purpose of this dataset is to display intersection density, a key aspect of walkability, within the study area. The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.

enttyp.enttypd: Estimated intersection density of walkable road intersections.

attr.attrdef: Estimated intersection density of walkable road intersections.

overview.eaover:
For more information about EnviroAtlas data, go to https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets.
In this dataset, the kernel density of intersections of walkable roads is displayed. The intersections displayed is not the number of intersections per square kilometer, but rather a number representing the accessibility of intersections at a given point. This dataset can be used by researchers, communities, and decision-makers to represent one aspect of walkability.
Processing steps were completed using Python scripts and some manual data management.
A comprehensive list of metric creation steps is included in the Processing Steps.
